intro: Gutierrezia mandonii subsp. isernii, commonly known as Isern's galleta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish composite flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
